intro: Koeleria argentina, commonly known as the Argentine grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Koeleria argentina is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species suitable for dry climates. Its fine texture and ability to thrive in poor soils make it a useful plant for erosion control and landscaping in suitable regions.
